hypothesis_content.title: Whale Accumulation Detection via Liquidity Asymmetry
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC shows sustained bid-side liquidity dominance (bid depth > ask depth by 2:1 ratio) for 4+ consecutive hours during NEUTRAL regime, with price remaining within ±1.5% range, subsequent breakout in direction of liquidity accumulation has >70% probability of extending >3% within 24 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Whales accumulate during low-volatility periods by placing large resting bids, creating asymmetric liquidity. Once accumulation completes, they initiate momentum to trigger stop-losses and attract followers.
entry_conditions: BTC order book shows bid depth > ask depth by 2:1 ratio for 4+ hours
Price remains within ±1.5% range during accumulation period
Volume during period is <80% of 20-day average (stealth accumulation)
No major news events during accumulation window
Regime is NEUTRAL (61.5% confidence matches current state)

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Breakout fails and price returns to accumulation range midpoint

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If asymmetric liquidity patterns fail to predict direction or magnitude of subsequent moves in >30% of cases.
